rules: Rule1: Provided that the developer uses a compiler, the project is successful.
Rule2: If the team adopts a new framework, then the team implements the feature.
Rule3: The team adopts a new framework or the team adopts a legacy system.
Rule4: Under the condition that the team adopts a legacy system, the project is successful.
Rule5: If the team implements the feature, then the team tests the feature.
Rule6: Whenever the team tests the feature, the team deploys the feature.
Rule7: Provided that the team has a conflict with the client, the team resolves the conflict with the client.
Rule8: If the team has a conflict with the client, then it is not the case that the team resolves the conflict with the client.
Rule9: Whenever the project is in the current sprint, the project is successful.
Rule10: If the project requires an extension, then the project misses its deadline.
Rule11: Provided that the developer uses a debugger, the project is successful.
Rule12: If the client approves the extension, then, whenever the manager requests an extension from the client, the project requires an extension.
Rule13: Provided that the client rejects the extension, if the manager requests an extension from the client, then the project requires an extension.
Rule14: If the team has a good relation with the client, then the client approves the extension.
Rule15: Either the team has a good relation with the client or the team has a poor relation with the client.
Rule16: Under the condition that the team has a poor relation with the client, the client rejects the extension.
Rule17: Whenever the project is put on hold, the project is cancelled.
Rule18: Provided that the project is scaled down, the project is put on hold.
Rule19: The project has a budget overrun or the project has scope creep.
Rule20: Under the condition that the project has scope creep, if the project is not successful, then the project is scaled down.
Rule21: If the developer has programming skill, then the developer uses a compiler.
Rule22: Provided that the team uses CI/CD, the team automates the pipeline.
Rule23: The team uses CI/CD or the team uses manual deployment.
Rule24: Under the condition that the team uses manual deployment, the project is successful.
Rule25: Whenever the team automates the pipeline, the team achieves rapid releases.
Rule26: If the project is in the next sprint, then the manager audits the deployment.

Rule27: Whenever the manager monitors the pipeline, if it is not the case that, if the team achieves rapid releases then the project is successful, then the team does not experience deployment failures.
Rule28: Under the condition that the manager audits the deployment, the manager monitors the pipeline.
Rule29: Provided that the developer has testing skill, the developer uses a debugger.
Rule30: If the company provides training to the developer, then, if it is not the case that the developer has programming skill or the developer has testing skill, then the project is delayed.
Rule31: The company provides training to the developer or the company hires a consultant expert.
Rule32: Provided that the company hires a consultant expert, the consultant advises the team.
Rule33: Under the condition that the training is successful, the developer’s skill is improved.
Rule34: Either the training is successful or the training is unsuccessful.

Rule35: Provided that the training is unsuccessful, if the consultant advises the team, then, if it is not the case that the developer has programming skill or the developer has testing skill, the project is delayed.
Rule36: Under the condition that the manager reallocates resources to the project, if the project has a delayed milestone, then the project misses its deadline.
Rule37: The manager reallocates resources to the project or the manager extends the sprint for the project.
Rule38: If the client approves a change to the manager, then, whenever the manager extends the sprint for the project, if the project has a delayed milestone, the project misses its deadline.
Rule39: Either the client approves a change to the manager or the client rejects a change to the manager.

Rule40: Under the condition that the client rejects a change to the manager, if the manager extends the sprint for the project, then, if the project has a delayed milestone, the project misses its deadline.
Rule41: Provided that the project has a major issue, the project requires an extension.
Rule42: If the project has failed, then the project is delayed.

Rule43: Under the condition that the team meets with the manager, if the manager responds to the delay, then, if it is not the case that the developer has programming skill or the developer has testing skill, the project has failed.
Rule44: Provided that the manager reviews the code, the team meets with the manager.
Rule45: If it is not the case that, if the team deploys the feature then the project is successful, then the team has a conflict with the client.
Rule46: If it is not the case that, if the project has a budget overrun then, if the project is not successful, the project is scaled down, then the project does not receive increased funding.
Rule47: Provided that it is not the case that, if the team achieves rapid releases then the project is successful, the team experiences deployment failures.

Rule48: Under the condition that it is not the case that, if it is not the case that, if the project has a budget overrun then, if the project is not successful, the project is scaled down, then the project receives increased funding, the project suffers a funding cut.
Rule49: Provided that it is not the case that, if it is not the case that the project is in the current sprint, then the project has a major issue, the client takes legal action against the company.

Rule50: If it is not the case that, if it is not the case that the project is in the current sprint, then the project has a major issue, then the client does not take legal action against the company.
Rule51: Provided that the project is not in the current sprint, the manager requests an extension from the client.
Rule52: If the project is not in the current sprint, then the project has a delayed milestone.
Rule53: Under the condition that the project is not successful, it is not the case that the project is cancelled.
facts: Fact1: The project is in the next sprint.
Fact2: The manager responds to the delay.
Fact3: The manager reviews the code.
Fact4: The project does not miss its deadline.
Fact5: The project does not suffer a funding cut.
Fact6: The developer’s skill is not improved.
Fact7: The project is not delayed.
